description: On 17 March at a meeting of a special commission of the Cabinet of Ministers, it has been announced that the validity period of a visa of foreign citizens located in the Republic of Uzbekistan will be automatically extended until 10 April 2020. Also, citizens of countries with the right to enter the country without a visa for a certain period of time (in case of violation of the established period) will be allowed to leave the country as an exception by 10 April 2020. In the above cases no measures will be taken against them. According to this decision, the Uzbek Foreign Ministry asks the leaders of hotel complexes, taking into account the current situation, to accept foreign citizens into accommodation facilities without any problems.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On 17 March at a meeting of a special commission of the Cabinet of Ministers, it has been announced that the validity period of a visa of foreign citizens located in the Republic of Uzbekistan will be automatically extended until 10 April 2020. In the above cases no measures will be taken against them. According to this decision, the Uzbek Foreign Ministry asks the leaders of hotel complexes, taking into account the current situation, to accept foreign citizens into accommodation facilities without any problems. UPDATE: Visas of foreign citizens will be automatically extended until 5 May 2020. Citizens of countries that have the right to enter the country without a visa for a certain period of time (in case of violation of established period), as an exception, will be allowed to leave the country until 5 May 2020.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: In accordance with the decisions of the Special Republican Commission for the preparation аf a program of measures to prevent the import and spread of a new type of coronavirus in the Republic of Uzbekistan on March 23, all regular air flights between the Republic of Uzbekistan and the rest of the world have been suspended, as well as entry into the territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan through all border points of foreign citizens and stateless persons (with the exception of stateless persons permanently residing in the Republic), as well as passenger transport (buses, cars and Railways); UPDATE: On June 14, Uzbek authorities announced that they will ease transportation measures amid a decrease in the number of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases from June 15. The Ministry of Transport has stated that certain international flights will resume with restrictions based on the country of departure's epidemic situation. Citizens and those with permanent residency, as well as individuals associated with certain business and diplomatic organizations and their families will be allowed to enter and leave the country at free will.

description: On 17 March at a meeting of a special commission of the Cabinet of Ministers, it has been announced that the validity period of a visa of foreign citizens located in the Republic of Uzbekistan will be automatically extended until 10 April 2020. UPDATE: The visa period for foreign citizens currently staying in the territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan has been automatically extended until 1 November 2020. description: On September 21, uzbek authorities have announced that the country's borders are to reopen from October 1, following a months-long closure due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Cross-border traffic and international trains and flights are expected to resume over the course of the month. Countries have been classified under a traffic light system as 'green', 'yellow', or 'red', depending on the levels of COVID-19 infection in each country, with different regulations regarding entry depending on the color. Travelers arriving from 'green' countries, which include China, Thailand, Malaysia, South Korea, Georgia, Hungary, Finland, Latvia, Austria, and Japan, will be able to enter Uzbekistan without restrictions. Those arriving from 'yellow' countries, which consist of Azerbaijan, Belarus, the UAE, and the EU (except for the UK and Spain) may enter provided they have undergone a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test in the 72 hours prior to their arrival.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On September 21, Uzbek authorities have announced that the country's borders are to reopen from October 1, following a months-long closure due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Cross-border traffic and international trains and flights are expected to resume over the course of the month. Countries have been classified under a traffic light system as 'green', 'yellow', or 'red', depending on the levels of COVID-19 infection in each country, with different regulations regarding entry depending on the color. Travelers arriving from 'green' countries, which include China, Thailand, Malaysia, South Korea, Georgia, Hungary, Finland, Latvia, Austria, and Japan, will be able to enter Uzbekistan without restrictions. Those arriving from 'yellow' countries, which consist of Azerbaijan, Belarus, the UAE, and the EU (except for the UK and Spain) may enter provided they have undergone a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test in the 72 hours prior to their arrival. All other countries have been classified as 'red', and arrivals must provide a negative PCR test and undergo a 14-day quarantine to be permitted entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
From 00:01 on March 24, all types of transport, including buses, cars, air and railway transport, will be closed from Tashkent. This decision was made on Monday by the Special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus, according to the telegram channel Koronavirus Info.
The restriction on entry and exit from the capital of Uzbekistan does not apply to cargo transportation. Only citizens permanently residing (registered) in Tashkent will be able to enter the city.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: According to the order of the special commision for fighting against covid-19 in Uzbekistan on March 26, from 06:00 a.m. of 27 March 2020 the movement of trams and buses in the city of Samarkand will be suspended.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as well as to ensure sanitary and epidemiological safety of the population, inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
From 00:01 on March 24, all types of transport, including buses, cars, air and railway transport, will be closed from Tashkent. This decision was made on Monday by the Special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus, according to the telegram channel Koronavirus Info.
The restriction on entry and exit from the capital of Uzbekistan does not apply to cargo transportation. Only citizens permanently residing (registered) in Tashkent will be able to enter the city. UPDATE: The policy has been annulled because all inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: From 6:00 am on March 30 to April 20, movement by car in Tashkent, Nukus and regional centers, as well as between regions, will be allowed only if there is a special permit in the form of a sticker issued by public service centers. According to the press service of the government of Uzbekistan, this decision was made by the Special Republican Commission for the fight against coronavirus.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: According to the decision of the Special Republican Commission on April 30, only from 7:00 to 10:00 and from 17:00 to 20:00 it is allowed to use personal and service cars with passengers, as well as bicycles and motor vehicles for trips to and from work, as well as for the purchase of goods essentials, medicines, medical products and food.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as well as to ensure sanitary and epidemiological safety of the population, inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov. UPDATE: From April 30, the Commission allowed movement between cities, districts and regions, as well as the entry and exit from Tashkent of all types of personal and service cars of legal entities and individuals involved in the cultivation of agricultural products.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: According to the order of the special republican commission on May 15, citizens will be able to use their personal car around the clock in regions with a “green” quarantine level. Without permissive stickers in the "yellow" regions, it is allowed to move from 06:00 to 22:00. In this case, there should not be more than 4 people in the cabin. In the “red” regions, citizens will be able to use their personal car from 07:00 to 10:00 and from 17:00 to 20:00 to travel to and from work, to buy medicines, medical supplies and essential goods.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as well as to ensure sanitary and epidemiological safety of the population, inter-regional traffic for all types of vehicles (cars, buses, air and rail) was stopped from 10:00 a.m. of 27 March. This was announced by the Minister of Internal Affairs Pulat Bobozhonov. UPDATE: According to the decision of the Special Republican Commission on May 15,  flights from Tashkent to Nukus, Urgench, Termez and vice versa will resume from 18 May. Also, from 18 May, Afrosiyob trains will start running from Tashkent to Navoi, Bukhara and Karshi. The commission’s decision states that high-speed trains will resume their operations in the Ferghana Valley (Ferghana, Andijan and Namangan Regions) and vice versa.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Uzbekistan from 10 July to 1 August again reinforces quarantine restrictions. The Special Republican Commission for the Control of Coronavirus adopted a corresponding decision. The country introduced a ban on the movement of vehicles between regions (except for official and personal vehicles of organizations involved in the cultivation of agricultural products).
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Uzbekistan from 10 July to 1 August again reinforces quarantine restrictions. The Special Republican Commission for the Control of Coronavirus adopted a corresponding decision. The country introduced a ban on the movement of vehicles between regions (except for official and personal vehicles of organizations involved in the cultivation of agricultural products). UPDATE: Quarantine restrictions introduced in Uzbekistan have been extended until 15 August 2020. On 31 July, 1-2 August and 8-9 August (on Saturdays and Sundays), the movement of vehicles and non-route taxis will be completely stopped throughout the republic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: According to the order of the Special Commision of Uzbekistan on March 28, due to coronavirus Namangan introduces nine days weekend from March 28 to April 5, residents are instructed not to go out unless absolutely necessary.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Uzbekistan: Following all regional centers, five major cities of Tashkent Region - Almalyk, Bekobod, Angren, Yangiyul and Chirchik - introduce self-isolation regime as of Apr. 14. UPDATE: Special Republican Commission on Prevention of the Covid-19 Spread in Uzbekistan extends lockdown measures until May 10.

According to the order of Special Comission of Uzbekistan on April 14, following all regional centers, in five major cities of Tashkent Region - Almalyk, Bekobod, Angren, Yangiyul and Chirchik - introduce self-isolation regime. Restrictions include: walking dogs should be done once a day and at a distance of no more than 100 meters from the house; citizens over 65 years of age are not allowed to leave their homes, an exception is made for trips to grocery stores and pharmacies located in the immediate vicinity of their homes; other residents should also leave their homes only for trips to grocery stores and pharmacies located in the immediate vicinity of their homes; when moving around the streets, as well as visiting trade objects and other places, it is necessary to maintain a social distance of 2 meters
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On July 11, the special Republican Commission for combating coronavirus in Uzbekistan adopted new decisions. On July 18-19, July 25-26, and August 8-9, residents were advised to self-isolate. On the same days, government agencies and other organizations were advised not to involve their employees in the work. In General, it is recommended to hold national isolation.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On January 29, 2020, The President of Uzbekistan signed a decree on the creation of a special republican commission to prepare a program of measures to prevent the importation and spread of a new type of coronavirus in Uzbekistan. The commission was headed by Prime Minister Abdulla Aripov. A special republican commission was created under the leadership of Abdulla Aripov. The commission’s tasks include continuous analysis and monitoring of the global, regional and country epidemiological conditions, forecasting the trends in the spread and possible worsening of the epidemiological situation of coronavirus in the country.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the basis of the Presidential Decree dated on March 19, 2020, the Republican Anti-Crisis Commission (hereinafter referred to as the “Anti-Crisis Commission“) was formed. The main task of the Anti-Crisis Commission is to resolve issues and ensure the work of economic sectors, social support of the population during the period of counteracting the spread of coronavirus infection. The territorial headquarters of the Anti-Crisis Commission are headed by the Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, khokims of regions, districts and cities respectively. The Prime Minister is also the head of the Anti-Crisis Commission.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 17, “Starting from 18 March, teachers will go on paid leave. The work that they had to carry out during the holidays from 21 to 28 March, they will do remotely," the Minister of Public Education Sherzod Shermatov said. School principals, their deputies, managers, psychologists, janitors and caretakers will continue to work in schools. The length of the holidays for schoolchildren will depend on the situation, Shermatov said.

description:
On March 20, The Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan created an official website http://coronavirus.uz, where users can get all the necessary information about coronavirus infection.
In particular, it refers to the epidemic situation in Uzbekistan, daily operational data, and the latest news from reliable sources. The users can also find contact details of the headquarters of the regional health departments, the operational headquarters of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the embassies of our country in foreign countries. And useful information and recommendations on how to protect the usersrself and protect the usersrself from COVID-19 helps to increase public awareness. Also on the site the users can find a list of reliable sources of information.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uzbek National Chamber of Innovative Healthcare launched a telegram channel “National Chamber COVID-19” (https://t.me/uzhealth_covid2019) to collect requests from health professionals who want to help fight coronavirus.

enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 2, The Ministry of Health of Republic of Uzbekistan announced the development and launch of an online telegram of a consultant bot together with Unified Integrator UZINFOCOM LLC to provide medically sound answers to citizens' questions. On the site, people can see the map, which shows in which regions confirmation of coronavirus infection is recorded. Secondly, under this card there is a button “Epidemiological route of patients with confirmed coronavirus infection COVID-19”. By clicking on it, people can trace in what places the patients managed to visit before arriving at the hospital. Having received this information, be careful not to visit these places
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted

description: In accordance with the resolution of the Special Republican Commission of Republic of Uzbekistan, from 23 March, weddings and other family events and ceremonies with the participation of a large number of people are prohibited (the number of participants should not exceed 10-15). UPDATE: According to the decision of Special Commission made on August 12, starting from August 15,  it is allowed to hold family events in the homes and courtyards of citizens, but the number of guests must not exceed 30 people
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: According to the announcement of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan on August 20, it has been announced that, this year, due to the situation with the pandemic, the holding of mass gatherings and celebrations on Independence Day on September 1st will be limited. It is recommended to celebrate the event mainly in the family circle.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The "chairman of the Board of Muslims of Uzbekistan, Mufti Usmonkhon Alimov, has issued a fatwa placing a temporary ban on Friday prayers in mosques" on March 16. UPDATE: According to the decision of the Special Commission of Uzbekistan on September 1st, starting from September 5, collective services in religious institutions (services on Fridays and Saturdays) will be resumed with the strict observance of sanitary and hygienic and disinfection requirements
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)
